title: HOMA-IR (Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance)
description: Approximates insulin resistance using fasting glucose and insulin levels. A simple, non-invasive method to quantify insulin resistance and beta-cell function.

parameters.name: fasting_insulin
parameters.description: Fasting insulin level (must be fasting for at least 8 hours)

parameters.name: fasting_glucose
parameters.description: Fasting glucose level (must be fasting for at least 8 hours)

result.name: homa_ir_score
result.description: HOMA-IR score indicating degree of insulin resistance

ranges.interpretation: HOMA-IR below normal range. This may indicate insulin sensitivity, but consider clinical context.
Normal insulin resistance range (0.7-2.0). No evidence of significant insulin resistance.
Borderline insulin resistance (2.0-2.5). Consider lifestyle modifications and monitoring for metabolic syndrome risk factors.
Moderate insulin resistance (2.5-5.0). Increased risk for type 2 diabetes and metabolic syndrome. Consider comprehensive metabolic evaluation.
Severe insulin resistance (>5.0). High risk for type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease. Recommend comprehensive evaluation and intervention.

references: Matthews DR, Hosker JP, Rudenski AS, Naylor BA, Treacher DF, Turner RC. Homeostasis model assessment: insulin resistance and beta-cell function from fasting plasma glucose and insulin concentrations in man. Diabetologia. 1985 Jul;28(7):412-9.

Tohidi M, Ghasemi A, Hadaegh F, Derakhshan A, Chary A, Azizi F. Age- and sex-specific reference values for fasting serum insulin levels and insulin resistance/sensitivity indices in healthy Iranian adults: Tehran Lipid and Glucose Study. Clin Biochem. 2014 Apr;47(6):432-8.
notes: Should NOT be used in patients on insulin therapy
Requires fasting state (nothing eaten or drunk except water for at least 8 hours)
May have questionable accuracy in impaired glucose tolerance, normal BMI, or elderly populations
Should not be used as a standalone diagnostic tool
Most useful for epidemiologic, population-based, and group level assessments
Normal ranges may vary between populations and ethnicities
HOMA2 model is an updated version with improved accuracy
